etymology.description: semantic: 口 (mouth) + phonetic: 丩; original meaning: "to shout" (OC *kiːws).
etymology.interpretation: Mouth signals a vocal action, while 丩 contributes the sound, anchoring the reading. The graph first denoted shouting and later broadened to calling out or summoning someone.

examples.chinese: 小孩大声叫(小孩大聲叫)。
她叫我的名字(她叫我的名字)。
我叫他快来(我叫他快來)。
examples.english: I called him to come quickly.
